query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Sì come quando i primi raggi vibra 2 là dove il suo fattor lo sangue sparse, 3 cadendo Ibero sotto l’alta Libra,
4 e l’onde in Gange da nona rïarse, 5 sì stava il sole; onde ’l giorno sen giva, 6 come l’angel di Dio lieto ci apparse.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Just as when the first rays vibrate 2 where its Maker shed His blood, 3 the Ebro falling beneath the high Libra,
4 and the waves in Ganges begin to ripple at the ninth hour, 5 so the sun stood; hence the day was departing, 6 when the angel of God appeared to us, joyful.
**Cornish:**
1 Dell yw pan wra'n kynsa'n gweliow 2 le may fatel an gwaedh a sparyas, 3 an Ebro ow kodha dan Libra uhel,
4 ha'n tonnow yn Gange ow talleth dhe'n nawves avons, 5 hemma an howl; rag hemma an jorna a veu ow mos, 6 pan wrug an el a Dhew dhe'n ni omdhiskwedhes, lowen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Fuor de la fiamma stava in su la riva, 8 e cantava ‘Beati mundo corde!’ 9 in voce assai più che la nostra viva.
query.result:
**English:**
7 Outside the flame he stood upon the bank, 8 and sang ‘Blessed are the pure in heart!’ 9 in a voice much more lively than ours.
**Cornish:**
7 Mes a-ves an tan a veu ow sevel war an glann, 8 ha kanas ‘Beati mundo corde!’ 9 yn leun meur dres ev ow honan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Poscia «Più non si va, se pria non morde, 11 anime sante, il foco: intrate in esso, 12 e al cantar di là non siate sorde»,
13 ci disse come noi li fummo presso; 14 per ch’io divenni tal, quando lo ’ntesi, 15 qual è colui che ne la fossa è messo.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Then he said to us, when we were near him, 11 “Holy souls, no one goes further without first being bitten by the fire: enter it, 12 and do not be deaf to the singing on the other side.”
13 Because of this I became, when I heard him, 14 like someone who is put in the grave.
**Cornish:**
10 Wosa henna ‘Nyns eus mos mos ow mos, mar nyns yw kous, 11 ene ankow sawel, an tan: mos dhe'nna, 12 ha na vynjouch dhe'n kan dhe'n nessa’,
13 a leveris dhe'n ni pan omma nessa dhe'nna; 14 rag hemma my a veu dell pan klevyas henna, 15 dell yw henna owth eus settys yn an fos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 In su le man commesse mi protesi, 17 guardando il foco e imaginando forte 18 umani corpi già veduti accesi.
query.result:
**English:**
16 I threw myself forward on my clasped hands, 17 looking at the fire and vividly imagining 18 human bodies that I had seen burning before.
**Cornish:**
16 Yn war'n dhewlavrow my a rostellam, 17 ow sel an tan ha owth ymagyna yn fethys, 18 korfow tus ow kovsas owth esa gweliys ow tanow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Volsersi verso me le buone scorte; 20 e Virgilio mi disse: «Figliuol mio, 21 qui può esser tormento, ma non morte.
query.result:
**English:**
19 The good escorts turned towards me; 20 and Virgil said to me: “My son, 21 here there can be torment, but not death.
**Cornish:**
19 Yma'n troas dhe'n vy dhe'n scorta da; 20 ha Virgili a leveris dhe'n vy: “Va mab, 21 yma'n gallos bos tormen, mes nyns yw marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Ricorditi, ricorditi! E se io 23 sovresso Gerïon ti guidai salvo, 24 che farò ora presso più a Dio?
25 Credi per certo che se dentro a l’alvo 26 di questa fiamma stessi ben mille anni, 27 non ti potrebbe far d’un capel calvo.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Remember, remember! And if I 23 guided you safely over Geryon, 24 what will I do now that I am nearer to God?
25 Believe for certain that if you were to stay inside the belly 26 of this flame for a thousand years, 27 it could not make you lose a single hair.
**Cornish:**
22 Kov, kov! Ha mar my a'th ethol dhe'n Gerïon ow salva, 23 pyth a wra vyth ow th gorra dhe'n Dhew?
24 Kred dhe'n sur na mar byssi dhe'n kres a'n tan, 25 a-ves dhe'n tan a'n tanow ma, 26 nyns gallos henna ow th gorra dhe'n onan blew a'th wall.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 E se tu forse credi ch’io t’inganni, 29 fatti ver’ lei, e fatti far credenza 30 con le tue mani al lembo d’i tuoi panni.
query.result:
**English:**
28 And if perhaps you believe that I deceive you, 29 turn towards it, and have it give you proof 30 with your own hands on the hem of your clothes.
**Cornish:**
28 Ha mar byssi owth yma'm owth engan, 29 tro dhe'nna, ha gorra henna owth gorra kredens 30 gans dha dhewlavrow war an gwlas a'th dhillad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Pon giù omai, pon giù ogne temenza; 32 volgiti in qua e vieni: entra sicuro!». 33 E io pur fermo e contra coscïenza.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Lay down now, lay down all fear; 32 turn here and come: enter safely!". 33 And I, still firm and against my conscience.
**Cornish:**
31 Gorowghlemmyn,gorowghlemmynpubolldoweth; 32 trohahwelashaghadydh:dydhynsiw!. 33 Hagow,purfermhagynkontrankoeskens.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Quando mi vide star pur fermo e duro, 35 turbato un poco disse: «Or vedi, figlio: 36 tra Bëatrice e te è questo muro».
query.result:
**English:**
34 When he saw me standing still and firm, 35 somewhat troubled he said: "Now see, son: 36 between Beatrice and you is this wall".
**Cornish:**
34 Pan wrugavamevelstermhagkalet, 35 trobeledhunnbyghan,medhas: "Wrugavella,mab: 36 ynter Bëatrice hages yw an walma".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Ond’ ei crollò la fronte e disse: «Come! 44 volenci star di qua?»; indi sorrise 45 come al fanciul si fa ch’è vinto al pome.
query.result:
**English:**
43 Then he shook his forehead and said: "How! 44 Do you want to stay here?" Then he smiled 45 as one does to a child who is won over with an apple.
**Cornish:**
43 Pan yth krollas y fron ha medhas: "Kemmys! 44 ow volens star ena?" Pan yth sorras 45 vel pan wrug dhe'n flogh vyghan neb a'n gwayn gans pom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Poi dentro al foco innanzi mi si mise, 47 pregando Stazio che venisse retro, 48 che pria per lunga strada ci divise.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Then he placed himself before me in the fire, 47 asking Statius to come behind, 48 who had previously separated us for a long way.
**Cornish:**
46 Pan yth gorra y honan dhe'n tan warbarth vy, 47 ow pedas Stazio dhe dhedhes warbarth, 48 neb kyns pan wrug dhe'n fordh hir y'n rann.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Sì com’ fui dentro, in un bogliente vetro 50 gittato mi sarei per rinfrescarmi, 51 tant’ era ivi lo ’ncendio sanza metro.
query.result:
**English:**
49 As soon as I was inside, I would have thrown myself 50 into boiling glass to cool down, 51 so great was the fire there, beyond measure.
**Cornish:**
49 Vel pan wrug ow bys, yn boglyans gwydr 50 ow tosowgh vy dhe'n fordh dhe'n freskas, 51 kemmys o an tan an tan heb mesur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Lo dolce padre mio, per confortarmi, 53 pur di Beatrice ragionando andava, 54 dicendo: «Li occhi suoi già veder parmi».
query.result:
**English:**
52 My sweet father, to comfort me, 53 kept talking about Beatrice, 54 saying: "I seem to see her eyes already".
**Cornish:**
52 An tas dhodh, dhe'n fordh dhe'n confortya, 53 pur a-dro dhe'n Beatrice ow tos, 54 ow leverel: "Y gliw hy owth gwelas gorra".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Guidavaci una voce che cantava 56 di là; e noi, attenti pur a lei, 57 venimmo fuor là ove si montava.
query.result:
**English:**
55 A voice singing guided us 56 from there; and we, paying attention only to it, 57 came out to where one could climb.
**Cornish:**
55 Y'n gorra ni unn lef a gana 56 a-dhia; ha ni, ow tos attenta dhe'n hy, 57 a dheuth ni a-ves dhe'n fordh a-dhia monta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 ‘Venite, benedicti Patris mei’, 59 sonò dentro a un lume che lì era, 60 tal che mi vinse e guardar nol potei.
query.result:
**English:**
58 "Come, blessed of my Father", 59 resounded inside a light that was there, 60 so that it overcame me and I could not look at it.
**Cornish:**
58 "Dhedhes, benedicti Patris mei", 59 a sona bys yn goleudh a o an tan, 60 vel pan wrug ow gwaynya ha ny alla owth gwelas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 «Lo sol sen va», soggiunse, «e vien la sera; 62 non v’arrestate, ma studiate il passo, 63 mentre che l’occidente non si annera».
query.result:
**English:**
61 "The sun is going", he added, "and evening is coming; 62 do not stop, but quicken your pace, 63 before the west grows dark".
**Cornish:**
61 "An howl a-dhysk", yth leverel, "ha'n nos a dheuth; 62 ny alla owth lettya, mes studya an fordh, 63 bys na wra an west yn tywyll".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Dritta salia la via per entro ’l sasso 65 verso tal parte ch’io toglieva i raggi 66 dinanzi a me del sol ch’era già basso.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Straight rose the way up through the rock, 65 toward that side where I was taking away the rays 66 in front of me from the sun that was already low.
**Cornish:**
64 Urdh a wodha an fordh drehedhans an garrek, 65 dhegys an rann ma kyfsa an fordh an gwlaskor 66 rag an howlek kyns oedh isel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 E di pochi scaglion levammo i saggi, 68 che ’l sol corcar, per l’ombra che si spense, 69 sentimmo dietro e io e li miei saggi.
query.result:
**English:**
67 And with a few steps we climbed the stairs, 68 for the sunset, because of the shadow that was extinguished, 69 we felt behind us, both I and my wise companions.
**Cornish:**
67 Ha gans vythak a skalyow a wodhasen, 68 rag an howl korhel, rag an skwydh a spenjyas, 69 a glewfen ni ha’n keffrys ha’m fur gwythow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 E pria che ’n tutte le sue parti immense 71 fosse orizzonte fatto d’uno aspetto, 72 e notte avesse tutte sue dispense,
73 ciascun di noi d’un grado fece letto; 74 ché la natura del monte ci affranse 75 la possa del salir più e ’l diletto.
query.result:
**English:**
70 And before the horizon in all its vast expanse 71 had become one uniform aspect, 72 and night had taken over all its duties,
73 each of us made a bed of a step; 74 for the nature of the mountain deprived us 75 of the power and the pleasure of climbing further.
**Cornish:**
70 Ha kyns oedh an fordh oll an brassa brys 71 ow kul an fordh ow kul an gwlaskor, 72 ha nos oedh ow kul an gwella,
73 pub onen a wra dha leow gweli; 74 rag an naturel an meneth a wra ni 75 an gallos dhe’n fordh moy ha’n lowena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Poco parer potea lì del di fori; 89 ma, per quel poco, vedea io le stelle 90 di lor solere e più chiare e maggiori.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Little of the daylight could be seen there; 89 but, through that little, I saw the stars 90 brighter and larger than their usual size.
**Cornish:**
88 Byghan a wra gwelas ena an dydh a-ves, 89 mes, rag an byghan na, mi a welas an steren 90 moy kler ha moy vra na aga solere.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Sì ruminando e sì mirando in quelle, 92 mi prese il sonno; il sonno che sovente, 93 anzi che ’l fatto sia, sa le novelle.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Thus musing and gazing at them, 92 sleep overcame me; sleep, which often 93 knows the news before it happens.
**Cornish:**
91 Dell ow pos ha ow sel y’n aga mysk, 92 an kows a wra’m kemerys; an kows na, 93 kyns bos an gwrians, a wra ow tos an nowethow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Ne l’ora, credo, che de l’orïente 95 prima raggiò nel monte Citerea, 96 che di foco d’amor par sempre ardente,
97 giovane e bella in sogno mi parea 98 donna vedere andar per una landa 99 cogliendo fiori; e cantando dicea:
100 «Sappia qualunque il mio nome dimanda 101 ch’i’ mi son Lia, e vo movendo intorno 102 le belle mani a farmi una ghirlanda.
query.result:
**English:**
94 At the hour, I believe, when from the east 95 Cytherea first shone on the mountain, 96 who seems to be forever burning with the fire of love,
97 a young and beautiful lady appeared to me in a dream, 98 walking through a meadow 99 picking flowers; and as she sang, she said:
100 “Let anyone who asks my name know 101 that I am Leah, and I am moving my 102 beautiful hands around to make myself a garland.
**Cornish:**
94 Y’n eur, mi a grys, pan wosa kyns an est 95 Kytherea ow rajya kynsa an meneth, 96 a wra ow tos ow loski bys vythkyn gans tan amor,
97 ow jowan ha brav y’m mysk mi a welas 98 benen ow kerdhes drehedhans an garrek 99 ow kemerys bleujyn; ha ow kanas hi a leveris:
100 “Gwra vythkyn a wra ow hwel an ow hanow 101 ow tos ow yw Leah, ha ow yw ow kerdhes 102 ow brav dorn y’m dro dhe wul an garlan.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Per piacermi a lo specchio, qui m’addorno; 104 ma mia suora Rachel mai non si smaga 105 dal suo miraglio, e siede tutto giorno.
query.result:
**English:**
103 To please myself, I adorn myself here in front of the mirror; 104 but my sister Rachel never moves away 105 from her mirror, and sits there all day long.
**Cornish:**
103 Rag lowena’m, ena ow yw ow tyski; 104 mes ow hwor Rachel vyth vyth na wra ow tos 105 a-ves y gila, ha hi a wra ow sedhes pub dydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Ell’ è d’i suoi belli occhi veder vaga 107 com’ io de l’addornarmi con le mani; 108 lei lo vedere, e me l’ovrare appaga».
query.result:
**English:**
106 She is eager to see her beautiful eyes 107 as I am to adorn myself with my hands; 108 seeing pleases her, and working pleases me.”
**Cornish:**
106 Hi a wra ow tos ow gweles y brav lygajyon 107 dell ow yw ow tyski gans ow dorn; 108 hi a wra ow lowena gweles, ha ow yw ow lowena ober.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 E già per li splendori antelucani, 110 che tanto a’ pellegrin surgon più grati, 111 quanto, tornando, albergan men lontani,
112 le tenebre fuggian da tutti lati, 113 e ’l sonno mio con esse; ond’ io leva’mi, 114 veggendo i gran maestri già levati.
query.result:
**English:**
109 And now, with the light of dawn, 110 which rises all the more gratefully to the pilgrim 111 the nearer he is to his lodgings on his return journey,
112 the shadows were fleeing on all sides, 113 and my sleep with them; so I got up, 114 seeing that my great masters had already risen.
**Cornish:**
109 Ha lemmyn, gans an splannder a-rag an dydh, 110 a wra ow tos moy lowena dhe’n pellgrin, 111 pub moy a wra ow tos owth, ow moy a wra ow tos owth,
112 an tywyllow a wra ow tos ow tosya 113 a pub tu, ha’m kows gans aga; rag henna mi a wra ow sevel, 114 ow gweles ow brassa mesterow ow sevel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 «Quel dolce pome che per tanti rami 116 cercando va la cura de’ mortali, 117 oggi porrà in pace le tue fami».
query.result:
**English:**
115 "That sweet apple for which, through so many branches, 116 the cure for mortals goes searching, 117 today will bring peace to your family".**Cornish:**
115 "An aval melydh ma, rag meur a vydhen, 116 ow pyth an medhegieth dhe'n verow, 117 hedhyw a wra dalleth peth teulu".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Virgilio inverso me queste cotali 119 parole usò; e mai non furo strenne 120 che fosser di piacere a queste iguali.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Virgil spoke these words to me; 119 and never were there gifts 120 that were equal to these in pleasure.**Cornish:**
118 Virgil a leveris dhe'n vy an gerow-ma 119 gerow-ma; ha neb anken a veu 120 par dhe'n plesans dhe'n re ma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Tanto voler sopra voler mi venne 122 de l’esser sù, ch’ad ogne passo poi 123 al volo mi sentia crescer le penne.
query.result:
**English:**
121 So strong a desire came upon desire 122 to be above, that at each step thereafter 123 I felt my wings grow for the flight.**Cornish:**
121 Kemmys o volonta warbarth dhe'n volonta 122 dhe bys vy dhe'n uch, pub cam a wosa 123 ow teva vy eselyow kreski dhe'n eghen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Come la scala tutta sotto noi 125 fu corsa e fummo in su ’l grado superno, 126 in me ficcò Virgilio li occhi suoi,
127 e disse: «Il temporal foco e l’etterno 128 veduto hai, figlio; e se’ venuto in parte 129 dov’ io per me più oltre non discerno.
query.result:
**English:**
124 When the entire stairway had been climbed 125 and we were on the topmost step, 126 Virgil fixed his eyes on me,
127 and said: "You have seen the temporal fire and the eternal, 128 my son; and you have come to a place 129 where I myself can see no further.
**Cornish:**
124 Pub an eskel oll a veu resek 125 ha ni veu warbarth war an pel renk ughella, 126 Virgil a wrug y dhelergh dhe'n vy,
127 ha leveris: "An tan tanow ha'n tan bydha 128 owth gweles, mab; ha'th dos dhe le powy 129 le may hy honan nyns yw gwellas vy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Vedi lo sol che ’n fronte ti riluce; 134 vedi l’erbette, i fiori e li arbuscelli 135 che qui la terra sol da sé produce.
query.result:
**English:**
133 See the sun that shines upon your face; 134 see the grass, the flowers, and the shrubs 135 that here the earth produces all by itself.**Cornish:**
133 Gweles an howl a wra'th sklerhe dhe'th tal; 134 gweles an erbothes, an bleujow ha'n prennow 135 a wra an norvys ena owth oberi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Mentre che vegnan lieti li occhi belli 137 che, lagrimando, a te venir mi fenno, 138 seder ti puoi e puoi andar tra elli.
query.result:
**English:**
136 While the beautiful eyes that, 137 weeping, made me come to you, 138 come joyfully, you can sit and walk among them.**Cornish:**
136 Tra henna bos an hejerow melyon 137 a wra, ow weli, owth oberi dhe'th dos, 138 ty a yll sevel ha mos ha bos anedha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Non aspettar mio dir più né mio cenno; 140 libero, dritto e sano è tuo arbitrio, 141 e fallo fora non fare a suo senno:
142 per ch’io te sovra te corono e mitrio».
query.result:
**English:**
139 Do not expect me to say more or give you a sign; 140 your free will is upright and sound, 141 and it would be wrong not to act according to its judgment:
142 therefore I crown and miter you over yourself.**Cornish:**
139 Na wra'th gorthugh vy dheth leverel moy ha'n arwodh; 140 frank, straght ha iach yw dheth arbedna, 141 ha'n kamm vy dhe'n oberi a-dhodho dhe'n arbedna:
142 rag henna vy owth kuruna ha owth mitra dhe'th warbarth dhe'th honan.
